content:
What a wonderful initiative! Raising awareness about mental health is crucial, and I'm happy to help you with that. Here are some credible websites and organizations that provide reliable mental health resources:

**Websites:**

1. **National Institute of Mental Health (NIMH)**: [www.nimh.nih.gov](http://www.nimh.nih.gov) - A trusted government website with information on various mental health conditions, research, and treatment options.
2. **American Psychological Association (APA)**: [www.apa.org](http://www.apa.org) - A professional organization of psychologists offering resources on mental health topics, including articles, videos, and podcasts.
3. **Mental Health America**: [www.mentalhealthamerica.net](http://www.mentalhealthamerica.net) - A comprehensive website with information on mental health conditions, treatment options, and resources for finding help.
4. **The National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI)**: [www.nami.org](http://www.nami.org) - A grassroots organization providing education, support, and advocacy for individuals and families affected by mental illness.
5. **Psychology Today**: [www.psychologytoday.com](http://www.psychologytoday.com) - A website featuring articles, blogs, and a directory of mental health professionals.
6. **Crisis Text Line**: [www.crisistextline.org](http://www.crisistextline.org) - A free, 24/7 text messaging service for people in crisis.

**Organizations:**

1. **World Health Organization (WHO)**: [www.who.int](http://www.who.int) - A global health authority providing information on mental health, including data, publications, and resources.
2. **Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA)**: [www.samhsa.gov](http://www.samhsa.gov) - A US government agency focused on mental health and substance abuse prevention, treatment, and recovery.
3. **The Trevor Project**: [www.thetrevorproject.org](http://www.thetrevorproject.org) - A organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services for LGBTQ youth.
4. **Anxiety and Depression Association of America (ADAA)**: [www.adaa.org](http://www.adaa.org) - A organization dedicated to promoting awareness and treatment of anxiety and depression disorders.

**Hotlines:**

1. **National Suicide Prevention Lifeline**: 1-800-273-TALK (8255) - A 24/7 hotline for individuals in crisis.
2. **Crisis Text Line**: Text HOME to 741741 - A 24/7 text messaging service for people in crisis.

Remember to always verify the credibility of online resources and consult with mental health professionals if you or someone you know is struggling with mental health issues.

Good luck with your online campaign, and thank you for raising awareness about mental health!
